paragraphs.text: I’ve resigned myself to the reality that “don’t go to college” headlines make excellent click bait. As a consequence, I realize they won’t stop no matter how much I wish they would. paragraphs.name: 9a57
paragraphs.text: This article is the height of wealthy white privilege. People go to college to expand their world, to be pushed academically, to learn how to learn, to fall in love with ideas, or at the very least to learn a skill or trade. But if your father is a hedge-fund manager, sure, all that may not be so pressing. You can spend your days networking with him…

5e07bcb50708.title: If you’re a high achiever, this will be one of the most painful things you’ll ever feel in your…

paragraphs.name: b114
paragraphs.text: If you’re a high achiever, this will be one of the most painful things you’ll ever feel in your educational career. You’ll cry, feel absolutely defeated, and broken. You must fail. You must because as James says, you will die. Failure is a key component to success and life.

da616359dd91.title: I'll use the Google rule here: There is a school in Denmark that teaches students all this.

paragraphs.name: 5ff9
paragraphs.text: I'll use the Google rule here: There is a school in Denmark that teaches students all this. It's called Kaospilot (http://www.kaospilot.dk) and they teach in English. They offer the education we all need to succeed in life and which I wish I could have had 25, 20 or even 15 years ago. BTW, I don't work for them and I receive no compensation for…

paragraphs.name: e2b4
paragraphs.text: I agree completely James- my college experience was very disappointing. The useful skills I learned came from my own experience, not from a college classroom. I hope my children don’t go to college either :)

paragraphs.name: 1be8
paragraphs.text: Great article! I agree with your thoughts, although I don’t believe all essential skills can be taught — rather they have to be discovered. People often expect life lessons to be handed to them, as if they have no duty themselves to develop their knowledge and experience. Successful learning and good prospects later on in life requires an individual…

paragraphs.name: ef48
paragraphs.text: I thought homeschooling was a bad idea; this is even worse. The only reason to skip college is to avoid the backbreaking expenses and lifetime loans. To suggest that one doesn’t actually learn anything in college is simply ridiculous. What makes you think creativity, networking, self-reinvention — to name a few of your own “classes” — aren’t fostered…

f91d358a0325.title: I’m a professor and I see that many students do simply go through the motions and never really “get…

paragraphs.name: 03bb
paragraphs.text: I’m a professor and I see that many students do simply go through the motions and never really “get” how amazing the university experience can be--they never really learn how to learn, or, frankly, care to learn. BUT I fell in love with school and learned most of the items on your list during my undergrad degree, and I see other students doing this…

paragraphs.name: dc7a
paragraphs.text: The 1971 Supreme Court decision, Griggs v. Duke Power Company, remains largely unknown, but no ruling of the past forty-five years (except for Roe v. Wade) has done more harm to the American way of life. It changed the way companies hire, pay, and promote workers, ensuring that America would be a country defined by credentials rather than merit…
